questions.title:
Who conducted pioneering research on radio-
activity and earned two Nobel Prizes for
contributions to understanding atomic properties?
questions.bio:
Born in Poland and emerging as a prominent
figure in the late 19th century, this scientist's profound
investigations into radioactivity reshaped the field of atomic
science. Their groundbreaking discoveries not only laid the groundwork
for modern understandings of radiation but also earned them the
distinction of being a double Nobel laureate. Such a remarkable
achievement underscores their dedication and transformative impact
on the world of science.

questions.title:
Who made significant contributions to under-
standing molecular structures, including in
uncovering the DNA double helix?
questions.bio:
Emerging in mid-20th century England, this
brilliant mind's mastery of X-ray crystallography
unraveled the intricate structure of DNA's double
helix. Despite her pivotal contributions, her name
was often obscured, yet her legacyendures in
the realm of genetics and molecular biology.

questions.title:
Which mathematician's calculations were pivotal
in launching the first American astronauts into
space?
questions.bio:
This scientist's calculations were behind the
success of the first American spaceflights.
Their precise mathematical work ensured the
trajectories of astronauts were accurate and safe,
marking a significant milestone in space
exploration.

questions.title:
Who  is  often  regarded  as the  world's  first
computer  programmer (before the first
computers emerged)?
questions.bio:
In 19 century England, she envisioned a machine
that could process not only numbers but also
instructions, laying the foundation for modern
computer programming. Her work opened a realm of
possibilities, influencing innovators of the digital age.

questions.title:
Who was a movie-star and the co-inventor of a
frequency-hopping system that laid the ground-
work for modern wireless technologies?
questions.bio:
Born in 1914 in Austria, she helped develop a
system to prevent radio-guided torpedoes from
being jammed by enemies during World War II. This
invention, though initially overlooked, was
a precursor to today's technologies, including
Bluetooth and Wi-Fi.

questions.title:
Who  played  a  pivotal  role in confirming a fun-
damental theory in particle physics through a
groundbreaking experiment during the 20th century?
questions.bio:
Through a meticulous experiment, she provided
crucial evidence for the theory of weak interaction
in particle physics, challenging conventional norms.
Her innovative methods and fearless pursuit of
truth reshaped our understanding of fundamental
forces, leaving a mark on the world of physics.

questions.title:
Which pioneering mathematician made significant
advancements in the field of partial differential
equations?
questions.bio:
Born in 1850 in Russia, this mathematician made
notable contributions to mathematical analysis and
was the first woman in Europe to receive a doctorate
in mathematics.

questions.title:
Which scholar excelled in mathematics, astronomy,
and philosophy, leaving an enduring legacy in the
ancient world?
questions.bio:
Born around 360 CE, this exceptional mind
challenged societal norms, breaking through barriers to excel in
traditionally male-dominated fields. A symbol of wisdom and resilience,
her legacy continues to inspire scholars and thinkers across the ages.

questions.title:
Who became the first recipient of the Fields Medal
for achievements in the dynamics and geometry
of Riemann surfaces and their moduli spaces?
questions.bio:
Born in Tehran in 1977, this mathematician
made significant contributions to Riemann surfaces,
hyperbolic geometry, and topology. In 2014,
she became the first Iranian to win the Fields
Medal. Sadly, her influential journey ended in 2017.

questions.title:
Which scientist from Karnataka, India, was
instrumental in advancing the fields of microwave
engineering and antennae research?
questions.bio:
Originating from the Indian state of Karnataka,
this engineer's pioneering work in microwave engineering
has had profound implications in communications and radar technology.
Their extensive research and innovative methodologies have greatly influenced
the design and understanding of antennae systems. Throughout their career,
the scientist emphasized the importance of education and served as
a beacon of inspiration in the engineering community.
